I'm really going off these magnate downloads. With the old torrent method you could pick and choose what files you downloaded. For example; I've read a couple of comments about how dark the screen is and I see there are samples in the torrent. Previously I could download just the samples and check out the quality before commiting to the whole film. Now I have to download all 14 files only to have wasted my time if the quality isn't what I expected. Any ideas on how to work around this?

This is not a poke at Froggie incidentally, just a general comment on downloading a magnet file.

It's very easy to avoid having to download everything. After you select download, go to your download app (I use Utorrent), select the download then show the files - in Utorrent it's in the lower part of the window. You will see all the files that are being downloaded -- then in the Priority column right-click the file(s) you don't want to download and select "Don't download." Do this as soon as you start downloading. Very simple you see.

if using a magnetic link and I do NOT dl every single file in the "torrent" the latest versions of both bit and utorrent usually wont dl anything or will dl at .09k even with 10K seeders... never had that problem with actual torrent files

Criminet2: It's not froggie's case, BUT it is very possible. For instance, I downloaded a torrent called The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel 2012 DVDRip XviD- OCW. It was an .avi, and it had a readme. I downloaded the readme first, and it said "if you have problems watching, try with Windows Media Player". I tried with VLC and it was just curtains of colour, so I tried WMP. It had a screen with the TPB logo and it asked for my TPB username and password to verify I'm a human. I had slept very little last night, so I made the stupidest noob thing, I put it in (fortunately writing my username wrong, for the same reasons!). THEN another screen, asking me to download a DivX codec. Then it dawned on me that it was a more sophisticated version of a fake/spyware torrent, and slapped myself, for having to change my password which I remembered so easily all these years!
